{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Python can do more than the "+" operator for strings

{% raw %} 
'Hello'

'Hello'
{% endraw %}

'That is Alice's cat'

that does not work with single quotes

{% raw %} 
"That is Alice's cat"

"That is Alice's cat"
{% endraw %}

The escapce characte is a "\" backslash

other escape characters are

{% raw %} 
'That is Alice\'s cat'

"That is Alice's cat"
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print('Hello ther!\nHow are you?\nI\'m fine')

Hello ther!
How are you?
I'm fine
{% endraw %}

raw strings

{% raw %} 
r'That is Carol\'s cat'

"That is Carol\\'s cat"
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print(r'That is Carol\'s cat')

That is Carol\'s cat
{% endraw %}

A multi lines string in python starts either with """ or with '''

{% raw %} 
"""Dear Alice,
Today I went to nerverland, but you were not there.
Maybe you meant Netherlands, in which case I'm already there!
Until then,
Bob."""

"Dear Alice,\nToday I went to nerverland, but you were not there.\nMaybe you meant Netherlands, in which case I'm already there!\nUntil then,\nBob."
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print("""Dear Alice,
Today I went to nerverland, but you were not there.
Maybe you meant Netherlands, in which case I'm already there!
Until then,
Bob.""")

Dear Alice,
Today I went to nerverland, but you were not there.
Maybe you meant Netherlands, in which case I'm already there!
Until then,
Bob.
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam = 'Hello world!'
spam.upper()

'HELLO WORLD!'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print(spam)

Hello world!
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam = spam.upper()
print(spam)

HELLO WORLD!
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
answer = input()
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print(answer)

YES
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
answer == 'yes'

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
if answer == 'yes':
    print('Playing again?')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
if answer.lower() == 'yes':
    print('Playing again?')

Playing again?
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam = 'Hello world!'
spam.islower()

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam[1].islower()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam[1:11].islower()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam[1:12].islower()

True
{% endraw %}

Looks like "!" is perceived as a lowercase

{% raw %} 
spam[11].isupper()

False
{% endraw %}

There are other string methods

"Is title" are for all words of a sentence beginning with an Uppercase letter, the rest of the word being lower case

{% raw %} 
'hello'.isalpha()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'hello1234'.isalpha()

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'hello1234'.isalnum()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'1234'.isdecimal()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'   '.isspace()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'This Is A Title Case.'.istitle()

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'This is not a title case.'.istitle()

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello world!'.startswith('Hello')

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello world!'.startswith('H')

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello world!'.startswith('ello')

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello world!'.endswith('!')

True
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello world!'.endswith('world')

False
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
','.join(['cats', 'bats', 'rats'])

'cats,bats,rats'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print('\n\n'.join(['cats', 'bats', 'rats']))

cats

bats

rats
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'My name is Thierry'.split()

['My', 'name', 'is', 'Thierry']
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'My name is Thierry'.split('i')

['My name ', 's Th', 'erry']
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello'.rjust(10)

'     Hello'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
len('Hello'.rjust(10))

10
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
print('Hello'.rjust(10))

     Hello
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello'.rjust(20,'-')

'---------------Hello'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello'.center(20,'-')

'-------Hello--------'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam ='Hello'.rjust(10)
print(spam)

     Hello
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
spam.strip()

'Hello'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'    x    '.strip()

'x'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'    x    '.lstrip()

'x    '
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'    x    '.rstrip()

'    x'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'SpamSpamBaconSpamEggsSpam'.strip('ampS')

'BaconSpamEggs'
{% endraw %}

{% raw %} 
import pyperclip
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
pyperclip.copy('This is a clipboard test')
{% endraw %}

Reslut from the clipboard:

This is a clipboard test

{% raw %} 
pyperclip.paste()

'This is a clipboard test'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'hello '+ 'world'

'hello world'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
name = 'Alice'
place = 'Main Street'
time = '6 pm'
food = 'turnips'
'Hello ' + str(name) + ', you are invited to a party' + place + ' at ' 

'Hello Alice, you are invited to a partyMain Street at '
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
"%s" are called conversion specifiers
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
'Hello %s, you are invited to a party at %s, at %s. Please bring %s.' % (name, place, time, food)

'Hello Alice, you are invited to a party at Main Street, at 6 pm. Please bring turnips.'
{% endraw %}
